org.codehaus.preon.el
Interface ReferenceContext<E>

Type Parameters:
E - The type of environment that needs to be passed in in order to resolve a Reference created from this ReferenceContext.
All Superinterfaces:
Descriptive
All Known Subinterfaces:
ObjectResolverContext, Reference<E>, ResolverContext
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayElementReference, ArrayElementReference, BindingsContext, BooleanLiteralReference, ClassReferenceContext, ContextReplacingReference, ConvertingReference, ImplicitsContext, ImportSupportingObjectResolverContext, ImportSupportingObjectResolverContext.ClassReference, MultiReference, OuterReference, OuterResolvingReference, PropertyReference, PropertyReference, VariableContext
public interface ReferenceContext<E>
extends Descriptive

A context for building references to elements in an environment of E. The ReferenceContext interface allows us to build references relying on different types of environments.

The main reason for having the ReferenceContext interface is to have a better abstraction from the environment in which a Limbo expression is executed. With these abstractions, the component using Limbo in a certain context is still able to define the meaning of the selectors for that particular context. This allows Quarks to build meaningful descriptions of references by taking Codec information into account.

Author:
Wilfred Springer

Method Summary
 Reference<E> selectAttribute(String name)
          Creates a new Reference; the new Reference will be resolved by first resolving the current reference, and then use the name to navigate to another object associated to that object.
 Reference<E> selectItem(Expression<Integer,E> index)
          Creates a new Reference; the new Reference will be resolved by first resolving the current reference, and then use the index to navigate to the associated object.
 Reference<E> selectItem(String index)
          Creates a new Reference; the new Reference will be resolved by first resolving the current reference, and then use the index to navigate to the associated object.

Method Detail

selectAttribute

Reference<E> selectAttribute(String name)
                             throws BindingException
Creates a new Reference; the new Reference will be resolved by first resolving the current reference, and then use the name to navigate to another object associated to that object.

Parameters:
name - The name to be used to resolve the Reference.
Returns:
A new Reference, pointing to the object that is related to the original object by the given name.
Throws:
BindingException

selectItem

Reference<E> selectItem(String index)
                        throws BindingException
Creates a new Reference; the new Reference will be resolved by first resolving the current reference, and then use the index to navigate to the associated object.

Parameters:
index - The index to be used. (A Limbo expression.)
Returns:
A new Reference, pointing to the object that is related to the original object by the given index.
Throws:
BindingException

selectItem

Reference<E> selectItem(Expression<Integer,E> index)
                        throws BindingException
Creates a new Reference; the new Reference will be resolved by first resolving the current reference, and then use the index to navigate to the associated object.

Parameters:
index - The index to be used. (An object representation of an Expression on the same context.)
Returns:
A new Reference, pointing to the object that is related to the original object by the given index.
Throws:
BindingException
